snippet: Malaysia will ask three social media and Internet companies to curb content in the interest of public safety.
abstract: Malaysian Communications Minister Salleh Said Keruak says Facebook, Google and Twitter will be asked to curb content to preserve public safety; request is latest effort to quash dissent triggered by accusations of graft at state investment fund, which has proved problematic for Prime Min Najib Razak.
lead_paragraph: Malaysia will ask three social media and Internet companies to curb content in the interest of public safety.

headline.main: Malaysia: Seeking to Curb Social Media
headline.print_headline: Asia; Malaysia: Seeking to Curb Social Media
